episodeTitle: Mighty Leaders Face Each Other Down! Heralding the 'New Era'!
description: Following the Marine victory at Marineford, the world celebrates while new dangers emerge. Blackbeard recruits powerful Level 6 prisoners, Gecko Moria is attacked by Doflamingo under mysterious orders, and the Supernovas react to the dawn of a new era of piracy.

events.title: Impel Down Level 6 Breakout Revealed
events.description: Lieutenant Commander Brannew informs Fleet Admiral Sengoku about the catastrophic situation at Impel Down. Magellan is severely injured and blaming himself for the defeat, and many Level 6 prisoners escaped during the chaos. The World Government orders the incident to be covered up from the public.
events.significance: Reveals the full extent of the Impel Down breakout and the World Government's willingness to hide major incidents from the public. Sets up future threats from escaped Level 6 criminals.

quotes.speaker: Sengoku
quotes.context: Sengoku's angry response to the World Government ordering a cover-up of the Level 6 prisoner escapes

events.title: Blackbeard Recruits Level 6 Prisoners
events.description: Blackbeard's method of recruiting Level 6 prisoners is revealed: he forced them to fight to the death in their cages, with only the survivors joining his crew. He successfully recruited Shiryu, Catarina Devon, Avalo Pizarro, Vasco Shot, and San Juan Wolf. However, other Level 6 prisoners also escaped during the chaos.
events.significance: Massively expands Blackbeard's crew with some of the world's most dangerous criminals, establishing him as a major future threat. The escape of other Level 6 prisoners sets up future storylines.

events.title: Catarina Devon Debut
events.description: Catarina Devon, known as the 'Crescent Moon Hunter', is revealed as one of Blackbeard's new crew members. She is recognized as one of history's most formidable female pirates who was incarcerated in Impel Down's Level 6.
events.significance: Introduces one of the most dangerous female pirates in One Piece history and a key member of Blackbeard's crew who will become a Titanic Captain.

events.title: Vasco Shot Debut
events.description: Vasco Shot, known as the 'Heavy Drinker', is revealed as one of Blackbeard's new crew members. He was one of the heinous criminals sentenced to life in Impel Down's Level 6.
events.significance: Introduces another powerful member of Blackbeard's crew who will become the captain of the 8th ship.

events.title: San Juan Wolf Debut
events.description: San Juan Wolf, a massive giant, is revealed as one of Blackbeard's new crew members from Impel Down's Level 6. He is one of the largest giants in the One Piece world.
events.significance: Introduces the colossal San Juan Wolf who will become one of Blackbeard's Titanic Captains.

events.title: Avalo Pizarro Debut
events.description: Avalo Pizarro is revealed as one of Blackbeard's new crew members from Impel Down's Level 6. He is known as the 'Corrupt King'.
events.significance: Introduces Avalo Pizarro who will become one of Blackbeard's Titanic Captains.

events.title: Doflamingo Orders Moria's Elimination
events.description: In the backstreets of Marineford, Gecko Moria is attacked by multiple Pacifistas under the command of Donquixote Doflamingo. Doflamingo states that Moria is too weak to continue being a Warlord of the Sea and that it would be better if people believed he died in the war. When Moria asks if this is Sengoku's order, Doflamingo reveals the order came from 'even higher up'.
events.significance: Reveals the World Government's ruthless willingness to eliminate even their own Warlords when they're deemed too weak. Introduces the mysterious higher authority above Sengoku. Marks Moria's apparent death (though he survives).

quotes.text: You're too weak to be a Warlord. It's better if the world thinks you died in this war.
quotes.speaker: Donquixote Doflamingo
quotes.context: Doflamingo explaining why he's been ordered to eliminate Moria

quotes.speaker: Donquixote Doflamingo
quotes.context: Doflamingo's cryptic response when Moria asks if Sengoku gave the order

events.title: Kid Declares the New Era
events.description: Eustass Kid tells his crew that the war's end is not the conclusion, but rather the beginning of a New Age that no one has ever seen before. He recognizes that Whitebeard's death and his final words about One Piece have changed the world forever.
events.significance: Establishes the Post-War era as a major turning point in the One Piece world. Shows the Supernovas' recognition that they will be major players in the coming era.

quotes.text: It's not over. This is the beginning of the New Age, one which no one has ever laid eyes on.
quotes.speaker: Eustass Kid
quotes.context: Kid's declaration about the post-Marineford era

events.title: Hawkins Notes Luffy's Survival Odds
events.description: Basil Hawkins uses his fortune-telling abilities and notes that it's odd that the odds of Monkey D. Luffy being alive never reaches zero, implying Luffy has some form of destiny or protection.
events.significance: Foreshadows Luffy's important role in the future and his seemingly impossible survival. Establishes Hawkins' awareness of Luffy's significance.

quotes.text: It's odd... the odds of Straw Hat Luffy being alive never reaches zero.
quotes.speaker: Basil Hawkins
quotes.context: Hawkins observing Luffy's fate through his fortune-telling abilities

events.title: Apoo Questions Law's Motives
events.description: Scratchmen Apoo questions why Trafalgar Law, who is known for his brutality, would save Monkey D. Luffy. He suspects there must be some ulterior motive or catch to Law's actions.
events.significance: Establishes the mystery around Law's motivations for saving Luffy, which will be explored in future arcs. Shows the Supernovas' awareness of each other's actions.

quotes.text: Why would Trafalgar Law save Straw Hat? There must be some catch.
quotes.speaker: Scratchmen Apoo
quotes.context: Apoo questioning Law's motivations for rescuing Luffy

events.title: Hancock Reaches Law's Submarine
events.description: Boa Hancock tracks down Trafalgar Law's submarine using her snake Salome, who has the ability to sense things on the ocean floor. She lands on the submarine from a Marine ship after turning all the Marines aboard to stone.
events.significance: Shows Hancock's dedication to ensuring Luffy's safety and demonstrates her tracking abilities through Salome.

events.title: Hancock Petrifies Marine Ship
events.description: Boa Hancock demonstrates her Mero Mero no Mi powers by turning all the Marines on a ship to stone, allowing her to safely reach Law's submarine without interference.
events.significance: Demonstrates Hancock's Devil Fruit abilities and her willingness to use them against Marines to protect Luffy.

events.title: Jinbe Expresses Shame and Guilt
events.description: Jinbe, still heavily wounded, emerges from the submarine and expresses how shameful he feels because he failed to protect anyone precious to him during the war. Law tells him to rest or his wounds might reopen.
events.significance: Shows Jinbe's emotional state after the war and his feelings of failure regarding Whitebeard's death and Ace's death. Develops his character's guilt and sense of responsibility.

events.title: Ivankov Respects Law's Instincts
events.description: Emporio Ivankov and his escapees from Impel Down arrive on the Marine ship. Ivankov discusses Luffy's bravery and begins to ask Law why he saved Luffy, but stops himself, saying that sometimes instincts tell you what to do.
events.significance: Shows Ivankov's wisdom and respect for Law's decision to save Luffy. Reinforces the theme of trusting one's instincts.

quotes.text: Sometimes instincts tell you what to do.
quotes.speaker: Emporio Ivankov
quotes.context: Ivankov stopping himself from questioning Law's motives for saving Luffy

events.title: World Reacts to Whitebeard's Death
events.description: The episode shows various people around the world reacting to news of Whitebeard's death and the end of the war. They celebrate the Marine victory but also worry about what comes next. More ruthless pirates are expected to emerge, and Whitebeard's final confirmation of One Piece's existence causes pirates worldwide to surge with ambition.
events.significance: Establishes the global impact of Marineford's conclusion and sets up the chaotic 'New Era' of piracy. Shows how Whitebeard's death destabilizes the world's balance of power.

quotes.speaker: Sengoku
quotes.context: Reacting to the World Government's cover-up order

quotes.text: You're too weak to be a Warlord. It's better if the world thinks you died in this war.
quotes.speaker: Donquixote Doflamingo
quotes.context: Explaining to Moria why he's being eliminated

quotes.speaker: Donquixote Doflamingo
quotes.context: Revealing the order to eliminate Moria came from above Sengoku

quotes.text: It's not over. This is the beginning of the New Age, one which no one has ever laid eyes on.
quotes.speaker: Eustass Kid
quotes.context: Declaring the start of a new era of piracy

quotes.text: It's odd... the odds of Straw Hat Luffy being alive never reaches zero.
quotes.speaker: Basil Hawkins
quotes.context: Reading Luffy's fortune and noting his unusual destiny

quotes.text: Why would Trafalgar Law save Straw Hat? There must be some catch.
quotes.speaker: Scratchmen Apoo

quotes.text: Sometimes instincts tell you what to do.
quotes.speaker: Emporio Ivankov
quotes.context: Acknowledging Law's decision to save Luffy

themes.theme: The Dawn of a New Era
themes.description: The episode heavily emphasizes the shift from the old world order under Whitebeard to a chaotic new era. Kid's declaration and the world's reaction to Whitebeard's death illustrate this major turning point in the One Piece world.
themes.symbolism: Whitebeard's death represents the end of an era of relative stability, while the Supernovas and escaped prisoners represent the chaos of the new age.

themes.description: The episode explores how strength determines survival in the One Piece world, shown through Moria's elimination for being 'too weak' and Blackbeard's brutal recruitment method.
themes.symbolism: The Level 6 death matches and Moria's attack demonstrate that even former allies will be discarded if they're deemed weak.

themes.description: The World Government's cover-up of the Impel Down breakout and the mysterious 'higher authority' ordering Moria's death reveal the corrupt nature of the government and their willingness to hide the truth.
themes.symbolism: Sengoku's anger at the cover-up shows that even high-ranking Marines are frustrated by the government's secretive methods.

themes.description: Hawkins' observation that Luffy's survival odds never reach zero suggests themes of destiny and fate, implying Luffy has an important role to play in the future.
themes.symbolism: The fortune-telling cards represent the mysterious forces guiding Luffy's path.

characterSpotlights.development: Doflamingo's role as an agent of the World Government's darker operations is revealed, showing his willingness to eliminate even fellow Warlords.
keyActions: Commands Pacifistas to attack Gecko Moria
Reveals orders came from above Sengoku
Attempts to eliminate Moria under government orders
quotes: You're too weak to be a Warlord.

characterSpotlights.development: Kid positions himself as a leader of the new generation, recognizing the significance of the post-war world and declaring his intention to be part of the new era.
keyActions: Declares the beginning of the New Age
Recognizes the world-changing impact of Marineford
quotes: It's not over. This is the beginning of the New Age, one which no one has ever laid eyes on.

characterSpotlights.development: Sengoku's frustration with the World Government's secretive methods shows his more honorable side despite being a Marine leader.
keyActions: Learns about the Impel Down prisoner escapes
Reacts angrily to the government's cover-up order

characterSpotlights.development: Hawkins demonstrates his fortune-telling abilities and reveals his awareness of Luffy's unusual destiny.
keyActions: Notes that Luffy's survival odds never reach zero
quotes: It's odd... the odds of Straw Hat Luffy being alive never reaches zero.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expands on the Supernovas' reactions to the war's conclusion with additional dialogue and scenes.
The anime shows more detail of the Level 6 prisoners escaping and their appearances.

trivia.fact: This episode was originally scheduled to air on March 13, 2011, but was delayed by one week due to extensive news coverage of the 2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami that occurred on March 11, 2011.
This is the first episode of the Post-War Arc, which serves as a transitional arc between the Summit War Saga and the Fish-Man Island Saga.
The episode title in Japanese, '群雄割拠', is an idiom meaning 'rival warlords vying for supremacy' or 'great men struggling for power', perfectly encapsulating the new era of competing powerful pirates.
Catarina Devon, Vasco Shot, San Juan Wolf, and Avalo Pizarro all make their first appearances in this episode as new Blackbeard Pirates members.
